channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+4110] Google Street View - Beyond What You Expect
[+3428] Fast State Trooper
item.description: Montana State Trooper, In most of the United States there is a policy of checking on any stalled vehicle on the highway when temperatures drop to single digits or below. About 3 AM one very cold morning, Montana State Trooper Allan Nixon responded to a call.

item.title: [+2644] More advertisers pull support for Glenn Beck
item.description: Web site ColorofChange.org, reacting to a long line of racist comments about President Barack Obama, has managed thus far to knock loose from Beck's fold Lawyers.com, Procter & Gamble, Progressive, S.C. Johnson, Geico and, just this morning, Sargento.

item.title: [+2581] Guitar legend Les Paul dies at age 94
item.description: WHITE PLAINS, N.Y. — Les Paul, the guitarist and inventor who changed the course of music with the electric guitar and multitrack recording and had a string of hits, many with wife Mary Ford, died on Thursday. He was 94.

item.title: [+2120] How Different Groups Spend Their Day (Infographic)
item.description: The American Time Use Survey asks thousands of American residents to recall every minute of a day. Here is how people over age 15 spent their time.

item.title: [+1950] Finally, a health care protester we all can get behind (PIC)
item.description: I think I made a huge mistake.

item.title: [+1888] How Men And Women Argue [Flowchart]
item.description: Men and women have very different ways of arguing. So, in a better effort to help couples understand each other, we decided to break down the thought process of both a man and woman, during an argument.

item.title: [+1556] The 20 Greatest Shows Canceled By Fox Before Their Time
item.description: We probably could have done 40 or so, but we were afraid Fox would cancel some more good shows before we finished.

item.title: [+1406] There's Just No Way Sarah Palin's Writing Her Facebook Notes
item.description: Just before midnight, a "note" was posted on Sarah Palin's Facebook page titled, "Concerning the "Death Panels." Predictably, the media latched onto it and reported her thoughts. However, there's a problem: there's no way in hell Sarah Palin wrote it.

item.title: [+1338] WARNING!
[+1336] Wingnut Grabs Black Lady’s Rosa Parks Poster, Rips It Up
item.description: Oh, oh yes, do watch this video from Claire McCaskill’s town hall yesterday. Old serial killer-ish guy just gets up from the bleachers, STEALS the black lady’s poster of Rosa Parks that she’d been showing a reporter, rips and crumples it up, cops chase ‘em all out, and everyone boos the black lady. Raw Democracy!

item.title: [+1282] Prevent Canada from Becoming a Copyright Police State
item.description: Canada is planning to reform its copyright law and if the entertainment industries have their way, the rights and privacy of consumers will be thrown overboard. It’s time for all Canadian BitTorrent users to stand up against the increasing power of the anti-piracy lobby, before it’s too late.

item.title: [+1034] An Insider On the Apple Tablet - apple tablet - Gizmodo
item.description: Despite the rumors, I never fully believed the apple tablet was real, until I heard these words over my phone: Hey, its [redacted]. I may or may not have sat in some Apple meetings for the tablet.

item.title: [+831] What's your name?
[+818] Blindfolded Man Tricked Into Hitting Himself in the Nuts
item.description: Yup, the old construct a crude seesaw underneath the victims genitals and trick him into throwing a log at the far end of it switcheroo!

item.title: [+774] Congratulations U.S., We Pay The Most For Cellphone Service
item.description: A new survey from the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD) compared annual costs around the world for consumers who have cellphones, and the U.S. is in the top three for most expensive. How expensive? On average Americans pay $635.85 on cell phone service, compared to $131.44 per year in the Netherlands.

item.title: [+723] If Wolfenstein Beats Madden, It's Free
item.description: You wouldn't believe this. Raven Software's Manveer Heir has posted a message on his Twitter stating that if Wolfenstein outsells Madden 10 in the month of

item.title: [+708] Insurance Companies Revoke Sick People's Health Coverage
item.description: You might have known that insurers can deny health coverage based on preexisting medical conditions, but here’s something else to worry about: They can take away the coverage you thought you had when actually need it, the government says. The Department of Health and Human Services put a spotlight on that practice Tuesday.

item.title: [+701] Stephen Hawking receives Presidential Medal of Freedom
item.description: Stephen Hawking was among the recipients at the White House today when President Barack Obama presented the National Medal of Freedom to 16 agents of change.

item.title: [+686] Oh how the mighty (morphin power rangers) have fallen
item.description: After school TV was the best. It was your personal time to eat oreos, fruit snacks, and put off homework until after dinner. Depending on your age, you’d get a healthy dose of cartoons, Saved By The Bell, and/or Power Rangers.
